p: The vast majority of svRNA (96.7%) mapped to segments 1, 2, 3, and 6 ( S3 Table). In any given sample, approximately half the svRNA reads were derived from segment 3 (PA), which was significantly more abundant than the next most common source for svRNA, segment 2 ( p = 0.0005; Fig 4B). The fraction of total reads attributed to each segment did not correlate with the percentage of total svRNA attributed to the segment ( R 2 = 0.098; Fig 5). This result indicates that these reads are unlikely to be random breakdown fragments of longer RNAs from the same segment and that the overrepresentation of svRNA from certain segments is unlikely to be from the virion inocula.
